title: 115_hr3416
content: Rural and Mountainous Advisory Council. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a Rural and Mountainous Advisory Council within the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, consisting of diverse members appointed for three-year terms. The Rural and Mountainous Advisory Council, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation for three-year terms, will fill vacancies in the same manner as the original appointment. The Council's duties include gathering information, providing technical advice, and making recommendations to enhance the safety and reliability of highly automated vehicles in challenging geographical or weather conditions. The Rural and Mountainous Advisory Council, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation, will report recommendations to Congress and receive technical assistance as needed. The Council's operation must comply with the Federal Advisory Committee Act, and the Secretary may detail Department of Transportation personnel to assist with duties. Members of the Council shall serve without pay, except for travel and per diem expenses for meetings called by the Secretary. The Council shall terminate 6 years after the date of enactment of this Act. Definitions include "automated driving system" as hardware and software capable of performing the entire dynamic driving task, and "dynamic driving task" as real-time operational and tactical functions. The real-time operational and tactical functions required for vehicle operation in traffic include steering, acceleration, monitoring the driving environment, object and event response, maneuver planning, and enhancing conspicuity through lighting and signaling. The term "highly automated vehicle" refers to a motor vehicle equipped with an automated driving system, excluding commercial vehicles. The term "operational design domain" specifies the conditions under which a driving automation system functions. If SAE International revises certain definitions in Recommended Practice Report J3016, changes will be implemented. If SAE International revises definitions in Recommended Practice Report J3016, the Secretary must be notified. The Secretary will publish a notice in the Federal Register unless the new definition is deemed inconsistent with motor vehicle safety laws. If SAE International revises definitions in Recommended Practice Report J3016, the Secretary must be notified. The Secretary will promptly make any necessary conforming amendments to regulations and standards without the requirements of section 553 of title 5, United States Code. The Secretary may update definitions as needed. The Secretary may update definitions in subparagraphs (A), (B), or (D) of paragraph (1) if there are significant changes in highly automated vehicles impacting motor vehicle safety.
